[b][size=5][/size][/b][/list][font=Arial][size=2][color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] What are your PC specs?
[color=#1e84cc]A: [/color]Intel i5 6600k, GTX 980 4GB, 16GB RAM, 1920x1080 Full HD monitor, Windows 7.

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] So I should install ALL mods from this list?
[color=#3c78d8]A:[/color] No, definitely no. This is a guide - it gives you an ability to compare and choose. Moreover, when it comes to gameplay mods, they often change the same things in game, sometimes are script-heavy so you may think install them or no and so on, so you need to carefully choose each mod you like and read about it. Open mod pages, browse the images, read the description. Install what you like and don't install what you don't like, but remember to not overload your game, don't install mods blindly :)

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] How about modded game stability in overall?
[color=#1e84cc]A:[/color] Please, follow "How to start & stability" section in graphics guide. This is required. Mandatory. You can not skip this. Even if you don't plan to use graphics mods themselves, you still must follow all the steps from this section. 

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] Is installation order important for mods from this guide?
[color=#3c78d8]A:[/color] Unlike with texture mods, installation order doesn't matter in 99% of cases, but load order matters. Mostly you can trust LOOT automatic sorting, but still, read each mod page attentively as it may have special instructions for manual load order.

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] I got infinite loading screen/my game crashes/I have enourmous stutters and FPS drops/I have some weird gameplay bugs.
[color=#1e84cc]A:[/color] Please read "How to start & stability" section in graphics guide carefully and "Before you start and essential mods" section in this guide. Read it and install all the things needed before starting to install mods from the list themselves.

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] That doesn't help!
[color=#1e84cc]A:[/color] Trust me, if you have read everything carefully and installed, it will solve all your problems in 99% of cases. If not, feel free to ask in comments, or better join our [url=https://discord.gg/PYNjv82]Discord server[/url] and community members or I will try our best to help you :)

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] I expected to find this mod in this guide section/category, but it's not there. What to do?
[color=#3d85c6]A:[/color] Sometimes gameplay mods are really complex and its can category be pretty "blurred". For example, Revenge of the Enemies mod is in "Gameplay Effects and Changes" category on Nexus, but it can be easily called an Overhaul as well, as it's a complete overhaul of almost all enemies in the game in meaning if their abilities. So, just keep reading. With 99.9% chance you'll just find it in another section. But if not - feel free to suggest to add it in Discord.

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] Where are you from? A few words about you?
[color=#1e84cc]A:[/color] Ukraine. 28 years old. Gamer, retarded slavic youtuber youtuber and gym addict. Web-developer in past, fitness trainer and nutritionist now (as hobby).

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] Would you expand this guide and add this/that?
[color=#1e84cc]A:[/color] Sure! That's why I made version 2.0. And for sure, I will update and improve it. Unstoppably. :)

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] Ok, guide just received massive update, but how can I see the little new additions?
[color=#1e84cc]A:[/color] I add mods and fix text errors few times per week. All the mods freshly added to the guide will be marked with red-colored "[color=#ff0000]==[color=#ff0000]NEW==[/color][/color]" sign.

[color=#ff7700]Q:[/color] Can you just upload your Skyrim folder with all your mods somewhere so I can just download it and not to choose and install mods one by one?
[color=#3d85c6]A:[/color] Unfortunately, no. The reasons:
Firstly - I can't do this as many mods from the list are Nexus-exslusive and mod authors didn't give a permission to re-upload their works somewhere. I respect their work.
Secondly - everyone has absolutely different PC specs, and my setup can be absolutely unplayable for many people.
Trust me - when you're making your mod setup by yourself the result will be way better because most of mods are absolutely matter of taste.[/size][/font]

[font=Arial][size=3][center][b]Now, the first and most important rule. Keeping it will drive you to the peaks of glory with 700 mods and 100% stable game[/b].

[font=Arial][size=3][color=#ff7700]1) Carefully follow the "How to start & stability" section in [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/76373]graphics guide[/url].[/color]
This is required. Mandatory. [color=#e06666]You can not skip this.[/color] Even if you don't plan to use graphics mods themselves, you still must follow all the steps from this section. This section is a base for a stable and comfortable game in overall no matter what mods you will install later.

[/size][/font][font=Arial][color=#ff7700][size=3]2) Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/77465]Modern Brawl Bug Fix[/url]﻿.[/size][/color][/font]
The ultimate solution to brawls that break instantly or turn into real fights. Compatible with any mod. [color=#ff7700]Note:[/color] if you will use Ordinator perk overhaul mod or Wildcat combat mod, you can not install this mod as it's uncluded in these two (if you are not sure, install it now and just remove later).

[font=Arial][size=3][color=#ff7700]3) Install[/color] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34093]Weapons and Armor Fixes[/url] [color=#ff7700]+[/color] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43053]Clothing and Clutter Fixes[/url][color=#ff7700].[/color][/size][/font]
Essential mods from amazing author. These 2 do exactly how they're called.

[font=Arial][color=#ff7700][size=3]4) Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49791]Complete Crafting Overhaul Remade[/url][/size][/color][/font][font=Arial][color=#ff7700][size=3].[/size][/color][/font]
Essential mod from author of previous two fixes. CCOR is reworking all vanilla craft recipes, offers many options for mining, chopping, smelting and so on - simply making everything crafting-related to be logical and really interesting. That's why you need it even if you never actually crafted a single thing in Skyrim - because now it's not that dull crafting system. Consider it as the vanilla part of the game as it always should have been from the release. Most of mod options can be enabled/disabled and configured via MCM menu.

[font=Arial][color=#ff7700][size=3]5) Install [/size][/color][/font][font=Arial][color=#ff7700][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70656]Wiseman303's Flora Fixes[/url] + [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54485]Wiseman303's Critter Fixes[/url] + [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/75511]Better Harvesting[/url].
[/size][/color][/font]Tiny and not noticable in general, but also must-have mods that are fixing various little bugs and/or irrational things. Important: when you'll be insatlling Better Harvesting, go to "Files" tab and download "Better Harvesting (for Wiseman's Flora Fixes)" version, and only this one (main file is not needed).

[font=Arial][color=#ff7700][size=3]6) Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36334]Inconsequential NPCs[/url].[/size][/color][/font]
[font=Arial][size=2]This mod is something game should have from teh day one - it's simply essential. It's adding various NPCs here and there in Skyrim, greatly fitting the city/town/region - you will never even think these NPCs are from the mod as they are acting absolutely seamlessly.
Carriages now finally have guards, there are skooma dealers and flower girls in Riften, much more mercenaries, college studends, tavern patrons, workers, towncriers and much more.[/size]

[color=#ff7700]7) Instal [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1175]Skyrim Community Uncapper[/url][color=#ff7700]﻿.[/color]
[/font]This amazing mod allows you to get rid of silly vanilla "legendary" skills system by simply uncapping your skills - so now you can raise skills above 100, and all related multipliers and modifiers (even enchanting and alchemy) will grow as well. Besides that, Uncapper does tons of oher useful things - you can determine leveling speed (strongly recommened to make it slower to not get lost on huge amount of new things in game if you have heavy-modded game), how many attributes you receive per at levelup (and at which level as well), how many perk points you receive at levelup (and at which level as well) and many other things. When just installed, it does nothing besides the very base. In "Files" tab section you can find archive with my Uncapper .INI files (different version for different tastes, also please be sure to read the readme) and use this .INI file, or just tweak it yourself, all lines in .INI file are pretty much self-explanatory.

[font=Arial][size=3][color=#ff7700]8) Install[/color] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14884]Fuz Ro D-oh - Silent Voice[/url]﻿[color=#ff7700].[/color][/size][/font]
An SKSE plugin that adds support for unvoiced in-game dialog which will be very useful to you in heavy-modded game.

[font=Arial][color=#ff7700][size=3]9) Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10753]Auto Unequip Ammo[/url].[/size][/color][/font]
A must-have mod which is simply automatically unequips bow/crossbow ammo from your back after ranged weapon is unequipped.

The one brave khajiit to rule them all. The one companion to pun them all. In my opinion, Inigo, while having not the numerically biggest amount of endorsments, is the best follower mod ever made. Inigo is a fully voiced khajiit adventuring companion with over seven thousands lines of unique dialogue - much of it about you. He doesn't just have some "on-call phrase" - he reacts on everything and everyone around you. He will comment, he will sing, he will scream, he will joke and he will troll. Both you and your followers as well. Inigo is one of those mods that make you give a complete new look on the game.
